description.line: Event management portion of the application was completely rewritten using Google Web Toolkit.
All the existing (UniTime 3.3) functionality has remained, a number of new features was implemented (see below).
New security model is introduced in UniTime 3.4
This includes both user authentication and authorization.
This allows for better integration of UniTime 3.4 with other systems at a university.
UniTime application can now be built using either Apache Ant or Maven.
Departments that can manage events (event departments) are to be specified on the Departments page. On a department, there is a new Event Management flag.

There is a new relation between rooms (including non-university locations) and event departments. On the Edit Room page, a room that is to have event management enabled must have an event department selected (in the ).

On the update, the relations are automatically populated using the UniTime 3.3 way. That is: An event department is a department that has a manager with an Event Manager role. Room is enabled for events if it is controlled by an event department.
Events page now contains all the filtering and display functionality that is needed for users to be able to see, request, and approve events.

In the Timetable view, events are equally spaced (to see how much each time is used). For room/personal timetable (when there is no or very unlikely overlap between events), events also shift into proper week/room.
Selection of time: allow selection of time from a drop down (15 or 30 minute increments) as well as type in (5 minute increments).

Room filter: free text box, with a drop down with selections for features / groups / types, also allow for boolean queries. For each selection, number of matching rooms is also provided. Room suggestions are also displayed. All the filtering capabilities are reachable via suggestions by just typing in (with no mouse clicking).
Event filter: combines event name, type and display mode into a similar component as the Room filter.
Functionality of Events, Meetings, Add Event, and Room Availability is merged into one page. This allows for easy swapping between different views.
The Timetable, List of Events, and List of Meetings can be easily filtered by a room or a week or weeks.

Event page defaults to "My Events" (events requested by me) in "Event" rooms (rooms with event management enabled), changes in the filters are remembered in browser (session) cookies. But it is possible to see (and query) class / examination events in all the rooms.

Users are able to see (and change) event meeting offsets (setup and teardown time). Published Time: the "official" starting and end time of a meeting. Allocated Time: the time during which the room is blocked (start - setup, end + teardown) Setup Time: the offset (positive number in minutes) between allocated start time and published start time Teardown Time: the offset (positive number in minutes) between published end time and allocated end time
An event can now have additional contacts entered (not just a set of emails).

It is now possible for the event to get automatically approved when it is entered by an event manager or an administrator. Only for meetings that the user has permission to approve. When "Event Location Approve" permission is enabled for the user.

It is now possible to make multiple changes (e.g., drop a couple of meetings and add some now ones) within the Edit Event page. Changes are only persisted (and the email notification is sent) at the end (when Save button is pressed).
It is now possible to approve / reject / inquire on multiple events at once, directly from the List of Events or List of Meetings.

Event Timetable page now contains much of the Events page, but it does not have the "My Events" default and it allows to see Room Timetable: timetable of a room Subject Timetable: timetable of a subject area or a course Curriculum Timetable: timetable of a curriculum or a curriculum classification Department Timetable: timetable of a department. Personal Timetable: timetable of a person, listing all classes, exams, and other requested events.
All event management pages are fully localizable.
English and Czech translations are provided.
Meetings and Room Availability pages are no longer needed -- all the functionality is available on the new Events page.
Classes, Examination, Personal schedule pages are no longer needed -- all the functionality is available on the new Event Timetable page.
Roles and their permissions can now be edited in UniTime which greatly improves customization possibilities.
The current Administrator role has been renamed to System Administrator role.

New Session Administrator role has been introduced. Very much like the System Administrator, but academic session dependent. Only system administrator is able to create and / or delete an academic session. Session independent entities (like room types) are only editable by system administrator. Chameleon is only available to a system administrator.
For instance, a course timetabling solution can only be uncommitted when the online student scheduling is NOT enabled.

User interface for alternative date patterns created. A date pattern can be of a new type "Alternative Pattern Set" Such a date pattern does not have any dates selected by itself, but other date patterns can be put into this set (one date pattern can belong into multiple sets).

When such a date pattern is assigned to a scheduling subpart or a class, one of the date patterns of the set are to be assigned to the class as a part of the time assignment. An individual preference can be set on each of the alternative date patterns (including required and prohibited).

Added ability to override distances computed using room coordinates by individual travel times set between pairs of rooms. These, if set, override the default distances that are computed using room coordinates.

Added ability to consider student distance conflicts between classes that are not directly back-to-back. Distance conflict is there if room distance (in minutes) is greater than the break time of the first class plus the difference between end of the first and start of the second class. To be enabled if needed by setting the solver parameter Distances.ComputeDistanceConflictsBetweenNonBTBClasses to true (defaults to false).

Can Share Room distribution constraint was added. Given examinations can share a room (use the same room during the same period) if the room is big enough. If examinations of different seating type are sharing a room, the more restrictive seating type is used to check the room size.

Room availability grid rewritten in GWT. Department code is displayed in each cell. It is now much easier to add / remove a department, add all departments. Localization (e.g., times / dates follow the locale settings) User interface is customizable, however, a lot of code still expects half hours starting on every half an hour.
Designators page and Designator Required toggle (on the offering) removed.
